definition: to kick/to play (e.g. soccer)/(slang) butch (in a lesbian relationship)
easy/amiable/to change/to exchange/prefix corresponding to the English adjective suffix "-able" or "-ible"
surname Yi/abbr. for 易經|易经[Yi4 jing1], the Book of Changes
lit. to punch and kick (idiom); to beat up/fig. determined to sort out a problem
to kick a ball around/(fig.) to mutually shirk responsibility/to pass the buck
PTT, the largest terminal-based bulletin board system in Taiwan/full name: 批踢踢實業坊|批踢踢实业坊[Pi1 ti1 ti1 Shi2 ye4 Fang1]
PTT, the largest terminal-based bulletin board system in Taiwan/full name: 批踢踢實業坊|批踢踢实业坊[Pi1 ti1 ti1 Shi2 ye4 Fang1]

pinyin: Pi1 ti1 ti1 Shi2 ye4 Fang1
Pi1 ti1 ti1 Shi2 ye4 Fang1

sentences.english: She was caught trying to sneak into the bar and was booted out.
sentences.chinese: 她被发现偷溜进去该酒吧，之后被踢了出来。

sentences.english: Punting is an important part of the game.
sentences.chinese: 踢凌空球是那项比赛的一个重要部分。

sentences.english: Kungfu martial artists learn the jump inside crescent kick in three different parts.
sentences.chinese: 学习功夫武术家内新月形踢三个不同的部分跳。

sentences.english: A furious player kicked his racket into the grandstand.
sentences.chinese: 一位愤怒的球员将他的球拍踢向了看台。

sentences.english: The mule was frightened and ran away, kicking wildly.
sentences.chinese: 骡子惊恐不已，疯狂地踢动着跑开。

sentences.english: The footballer kicked at the ball but missed and fell flat on his face.
sentences.chinese: 那个足球运动员要踢球，但没有踢到，闹了个嘴啃泥。

sentences.english: "When I've played I think I've done well, " he said, speaking to United's matchday programme.
sentences.chinese: “我觉得踢得不错，”他在曼联的观赛指南中说。

sentences.english: If you play according corner flag, it is possible to keep the ball entering the goal was.
sentences.chinese: 如果你照着角旗踢，就有可能让球进入球门了。

sentences.english: Don't kick the ball into the road.
sentences.chinese: 不要把球踢到马路上去。

sentences.english: How do I know she won't kick, or bite at my crotch?
sentences.chinese: 我如何确知她不会乱踢乱踹，或咬我的裤裆？

sentences.english: The horse lashed out at me with his rear leg.
He kicked the football sky-high for the extra point.
sentences.chinese: 他把“足球”“踢”得好高，多得一分。

sentences.english: He kicked at the bound prisoner.
sentences.chinese: 他朝那被绑着的囚犯踢了一脚。

sentences.english: He plays as a midfield play-maker but can also play on the wing.
sentences.chinese: 他可以当中场组织者也可以踢边路。

sentences.english: The horse kicked me when I tried to ride it.
sentences.chinese: 我设法骑那匹马时，它踢了我。

sentences.english: Annabel, taking all her anger out on the door, kicked it open and ran out of the office.
sentences.chinese: 安娜贝利说完就踢开了门，从办公室跑了出去。

definition: Sun Jihai (1977-), Chinese footballer, played for Manchester City (2002-2008)
(coll.) to take a taxi/to go by taxi
